keyword: calories in a pound of chicken breast
title: Calories in a Pound of Chicken Breast
meta_description: Discover calories in a pound of chicken breast, including protein, fat, carbs, per-100g breakdown, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in a Pound of Chicken Breast
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, cooked (roasted or grilled), no sauce/oil added; 1 pound â‰ˆ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut, cooking method, seasoning, water content, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of cooked, skinless chicken breast provides ~748 kcal and ~141 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Raw vs. cooked (adjust for ~25% weight loss)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 748 kcal for skinless, boneless, cooked chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 141 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Cooked; raw would be similar per gram but weight decreases during cooking.

faqs.q: Does skin affect calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, skin-on adds ~30 kcal per 100 g due to extra fat.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of chicken breast?
faqs.a: Around 16 g total fat for skinless, cooked; mostly unsaturated.
